definition: harmonious combination of Chinese and Western elements (idiom)
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: Show Western influence, many of the buildings reflects the combination of Chinese and Western content style.
sentences.chinese: 因受西方影響，許多建築都體現了中西合璧的風格。

sentences.english: Warlords built private gardens in Chinese and west styles with literatus' help.
sentences.chinese: 武人在文人的幫助之下建設有中西合璧的私家園林。

sentences.english: Breakfast at the hotel was an interesting mix of foreign and local breakfast options.
sentences.chinese: 酒店的早點是中西合璧的。

sentences.english: Basically, it is secondary education, and our goal is to cultivate first-class citizens.
sentences.chinese: 完整的高中課程教育，中西合璧培育優秀世界公民。

sentences.english: This is really the perfect ideal of Chinese and Western combine style.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏中西合璧，完美的組合了。

sentences.english: Warlords built private gardens in Chinese and west styles with literary' help.
sentences.chinese: 武人在文人的幫助之下建設有中西合璧的私家園林。

definition: to pass an exam (or the imperial exam)/to qualify
having a unique or distinctive style
interesting and appealing (of old locations, objects etc)
combining native and foreign methods (idiom); sophisticated and many-sided
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
